line_1: From East to West, o'er Rocks and Quicksands steers;
line_2: 'Tis Poverty, and that alone, he fears;

line_1: His quicken'd, onward course he steers.
line_2: Hush'd were his sorrows and his fears;

line_1: Where duty bids he confidently steers,
line_2: He holds no parley with unmanly sears,

line_1: To Padan-aram now his course he steers,
line_2: His hopes succeeded by a thousand fears;

line_1: Praise Him, who your agreeing Council steers,
Praise Him, who your agreeing Council steers,
line_2: Producing sweeter Sounds than the according Spheres.

line_1: Let me — where slow meander steers
line_2: Augment the water with my tears,

line_1: Rides the bark which virtue steers.
line_2: Safe, thro' seas of doubts and fears,

line_1: Where by tall groves his foamy flood he steers
line_2: Through ponderous arches o'er impetuous wears,

line_1: With steady hand th' experienc'd Pilot Steers,
line_2: And laughs in Northern Waves at Southern Fears,

line_1: And as the skilful pilot steers
line_2: Wide of the dreadful rocks he fears,
